trans-unit.source: Configure certificate profiles | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Configure certificate profiles | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create an Intune certificate profile.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create an Intune certificate profile.

trans-unit.source: Configure Intune certificate profiles
trans-unit.target: Configure Intune certificate profiles

trans-unit.source: After you've configured your infrastructure and certificates as described in [Configure certificate infrastructure for SCEP](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-scep.md) or [Configure certificate infrastructure for PFX](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-pfx.md), you can create certificate profiles.
trans-unit.target: After you've configured your infrastructure and certificates as described in [Configure certificate infrastructure for SCEP](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-scep.md) or [Configure certificate infrastructure for PFX](configure-certificate-infrastructure-for-pfx.md), you can create certificate profiles.

trans-unit.source: Here's the process:
trans-unit.target: Here's the process:

trans-unit.source: **Task 1**: Export the Trusted Root CA certificate
trans-unit.target: **Task 1**: Export the Trusted Root CA certificate

trans-unit.source: **Task 2**: Create Trusted certificate profiles
trans-unit.target: **Task 2**: Create Trusted certificate profiles

trans-unit.source: **Task 3**: Create one of two certificate profile types:
trans-unit.target: **Task 3**: Create one of two certificate profile types:

trans-unit.source: SCEP certificate profiles
trans-unit.target: SCEP certificate profiles

trans-unit.source: .PFX certificate profiles
trans-unit.target: .PFX certificate profiles

trans-unit.source: **Task 1**: Export the Trusted Root CA certificate
trans-unit.target: **Task 1**: Export the Trusted Root CA certificate

trans-unit.source: Export the Trusted Root Certification Authorities (CA) certificate as a **.cer** file from the issuing CA, or from any device that trusts your issuing CA.
trans-unit.target: Export the Trusted Root Certification Authorities (CA) certificate as a **.cer** file from the issuing CA, or from any device that trusts your issuing CA.

trans-unit.source: Do not export the private key.
trans-unit.target: Do not export the private key.

trans-unit.source: You'll import this certificate when you set up a Trusted certificate profile.
trans-unit.target: You'll import this certificate when you set up a Trusted certificate profile.

trans-unit.source: **Task 2**: Create Trusted certificate profiles
trans-unit.target: **Task 2**: Create Trusted certificate profiles

trans-unit.source: You must create a Trusted certificate profile before you can create a Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) or a PKCS #12 (.PFX) certificate profile.
trans-unit.target: You must create a Trusted certificate profile before you can create a Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) or a PKCS #12 (.PFX) certificate profile.

trans-unit.source: You need a Trusted certificate profile and an SCEP or .PFX profile for each mobile device platform.
trans-unit.target: You need a Trusted certificate profile and an SCEP or .PFX profile for each mobile device platform.

trans-unit.source: To create a Trusted certificate profile
trans-unit.target: To create a Trusted certificate profile

trans-unit.source: In the [Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Add one of these policy types:
trans-unit.target: Add one of these policy types:

trans-unit.source: Android > Trusted Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)
trans-unit.target: Android > Trusted Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)

trans-unit.source: iOS > Trusted Certificate Profile (iOS 8.0 and later)
trans-unit.target: iOS > Trusted Certificate Profile (iOS 8.0 and later)

trans-unit.source: Mac OS X > Trusted Certificate Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)
trans-unit.target: Mac OS X > Trusted Certificate Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)

trans-unit.source: Windows > Trusted Certificate Profile (Windows 8.1 and later)
trans-unit.target: Windows > Trusted Certificate Profile (Windows 8.1 and later)

trans-unit.source: Windows > Trusted Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 8.1 and later)
trans-unit.target: Windows > Trusted Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 8.1 and later)

trans-unit.source: Learn more: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md).

trans-unit.source: Enter the requested information to configure the Trusted certificate profile settings for Android, iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1.
trans-unit.target: Enter the requested information to configure the Trusted certificate profile settings for Android, iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1.

trans-unit.source: In the **Certificate file** setting, import the Trusted Root CA certificate (.cer file) that you exported from your issuing CA.
trans-unit.target: In the **Certificate file** setting, import the Trusted Root CA certificate (.cer file) that you exported from your issuing CA.

trans-unit.source: The **Destination store** setting applies only to devices running Windows 8.1 and later, and only if the device has more than one certificate store.
trans-unit.target: The **Destination store** setting applies only to devices running Windows 8.1 and later, and only if the device has more than one certificate store.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Save Policy**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Save Policy**.

trans-unit.source: The new policy is shown in the **Policy** workspace.
trans-unit.target: The new policy is shown in the **Policy** workspace.

trans-unit.source: Now you can deploy it.
trans-unit.target: Now you can deploy it.

trans-unit.source: **Task 3**: Create SCEP or .PFX certificate profiles
trans-unit.target: **Task 3**: Create SCEP or .PFX certificate profiles

trans-unit.source: After you create a Trusted CA certificate profile, create SCEP or .PFX certificate profiles for each platform you want to use.
trans-unit.target: After you create a Trusted CA certificate profile, create SCEP or .PFX certificate profiles for each platform you want to use.

trans-unit.source: When you create an SCEP certificate profile, you must specify a Trusted certificate profile for that same platform.
trans-unit.target: When you create an SCEP certificate profile, you must specify a Trusted certificate profile for that same platform.

trans-unit.source: This links the two certificate profiles, but you still must deploy each profile separately.
trans-unit.target: This links the two certificate profiles, but you still must deploy each profile separately.

trans-unit.source: To create an SCEP certificate profile
trans-unit.target: To create an SCEP certificate profile

trans-unit.source: In the [Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Add one of these policy types:
trans-unit.target: Add one of these policy types:

trans-unit.source: Android > SCEP Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)
trans-unit.target: Android > SCEP Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)

trans-unit.source: iOS > SCEP Certificate Profile (iOS 8.0 and later)
trans-unit.target: iOS > SCEP Certificate Profile (iOS 8.0 and later)

trans-unit.source: Mac OS X > SCEP Certificate Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)
trans-unit.target: Mac OS X > SCEP Certificate Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)

trans-unit.source: Windows > SCEP Certificate Profile (Windows 8.1 and later)
trans-unit.target: Windows > SCEP Certificate Profile (Windows 8.1 and later)

trans-unit.source: Windows > SCEP Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 8.1 and later)
trans-unit.target: Windows > SCEP Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 8.1 and later)

trans-unit.source: Learn more: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md).

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions on the profile configuration page to configure the SCEP certificate profile settings.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions on the profile configuration page to configure the SCEP certificate profile settings.

trans-unit.source: Under **Subject name format**, select **Custom** to enter a custom subject name format (in iOS profiles, only).
trans-unit.target: Under **Subject name format**, select **Custom** to enter a custom subject name format (in iOS profiles, only).

trans-unit.source: The two variables currently supported for the custom format are `Common Name (CN)` and `Email (E)`.
trans-unit.target: The two variables currently supported for the custom format are `Common Name (CN)` and `Email (E)`.

trans-unit.source: By using a combination of these variables and static strings, you can create a custom subject name format, like this one:
trans-unit.target: By using a combination of these variables and static strings, you can create a custom subject name format, like this one:

trans-unit.source: In this example, the admin created a subject name format that, in addition to the `CN` and `E` variables, uses strings for Organizational Unit, Organization, Location, State, and Country values.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the admin created a subject name format that, in addition to the `CN` and `E` variables, uses strings for Organizational Unit, Organization, Location, State, and Country values.

trans-unit.source: [CertStrToName function](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa377160.aspx) lists supported strings.
trans-unit.target: [CertStrToName function](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa377160.aspx) lists supported strings.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Save Policy**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Save Policy**.

trans-unit.source: The new policy is shown in the **Policy** workspace.
trans-unit.target: The new policy is shown in the **Policy** workspace.

trans-unit.source: Now you can deploy it.
trans-unit.target: Now you can deploy it.

trans-unit.source: To create a .PFX certificate profile
trans-unit.target: To create a .PFX certificate profile

trans-unit.source: In the [Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Add one of these policy types:
trans-unit.target: Add one of these policy types:

trans-unit.source: Android > .PFX Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)
trans-unit.target: Android > .PFX Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)

trans-unit.source: Windows > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (Windows 10 and later)
trans-unit.target: Windows > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (Windows 10 and later)

trans-unit.source: Windows > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 10 and later)
trans-unit.target: Windows > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 10 and later)

trans-unit.source: iOS > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (iOS 8.0 and later)
trans-unit.target: iOS > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (iOS 8.0 and later)

trans-unit.source: Learn more: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md).

trans-unit.source: Enter the information requested on the policy form.
trans-unit.target: Enter the information requested on the policy form.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Save Policy**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Save Policy**.

trans-unit.source: The new policy is shown in the **Policy** workspace.
trans-unit.target: The new policy is shown in the **Policy** workspace.

trans-unit.source: Now you can deploy it.
trans-unit.target: Now you can deploy it.

trans-unit.source: Deploy certificate profiles
trans-unit.target: Deploy certificate profiles

trans-unit.source: When you deploy certificate profiles, the certificate file from the Trusted CA certificate profile is installed on the device.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy certificate profiles, the certificate file from the Trusted CA certificate profile is installed on the device.

trans-unit.source: The device uses the SCEP or .PFX certificate profile to create a certificate request by the device.
trans-unit.target: The device uses the SCEP or .PFX certificate profile to create a certificate request by the device.

trans-unit.source: Certificate profiles install only on devices running the platform you use when you create the profile.
trans-unit.target: Certificate profiles install only on devices running the platform you use when you create the profile.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy certificate profiles to user collections or to device collections.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy certificate profiles to user collections or to device collections.

trans-unit.source: To publish a certificate to a device quickly after the device enrolls, deploy the certificate profile to a user group rather than to a device group.
trans-unit.target: To publish a certificate to a device quickly after the device enrolls, deploy the certificate profile to a user group rather than to a device group.

trans-unit.source: If you deploy to a device group, a full device registration is required before the device receives policies.
trans-unit.target: If you deploy to a device group, a full device registration is required before the device receives policies.

trans-unit.source: Although you deploy each profile separately, you also need to deploy the Trusted Root CA and the SCEP or .PFX profile.
trans-unit.target: Although you deploy each profile separately, you also need to deploy the Trusted Root CA and the SCEP or .PFX profile.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the SCEP or .PFX certificate policy will fail.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the SCEP or .PFX certificate policy will fail.

trans-unit.source: Deploy certificate profiles the same way you deploy other policies for Intune:
trans-unit.target: Deploy certificate profiles the same way you deploy other policies for Intune:

trans-unit.source: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy you want to deploy, and then choose **Manage Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy you want to deploy, and then choose **Manage Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: **To deploy the policy**, select one or more groups to deploy the policy to, and then choose **Add** > **OK**.
trans-unit.target: **To deploy the policy**, select one or more groups to deploy the policy to, and then choose **Add** > **OK**.

trans-unit.source: **To close the dialog box without deploying it**, choose **Cancel**.
trans-unit.target: **To close the dialog box without deploying it**, choose **Cancel**.

trans-unit.source: When you select a deployed policy, you can see more information about the deployment in the lower part of the list of policies.
trans-unit.target: When you select a deployed policy, you can see more information about the deployment in the lower part of the list of policies.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Next, learn how to use certificates to help secure email, Wi-Fi, and VPN profiles.
trans-unit.target: Next, learn how to use certificates to help secure email, Wi-Fi, and VPN profiles.
